data.title: Adam Schlesinger of Fountains of Wayne on Ventilator After Contracting Coronavirus
data.meta_description: The Emmy and Grammy–winning singer-songwriter is “heavily sedated,” his lawyer said.
data.text:
Update (March 31, 1:17 p.m.): Adam Schlesinger’s family has released a statement saying the musician’s condition is “improving.”

“Thank you for the outpouring of love for Adam and his family,” the statement reads, per Billboard. “Adam has been hospitalized with COVID-19. He’s on a ventilator and has been sedated to facilitate his recovery. He is receiving excellent care, his condition is improving and we are cautiously optimistic. His family appreciates all of the love and support.”

In addition, Rachel Bloom, the co-creator of Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, tweeted a request for her followers to “please keep Adam in your thoughts and prayers. It’s been an extremely scary week.”

The original post continues below:

Adam Schlesinger, the co-frontman of band Fountains of Wayne, has been put on a ventilator after contracting coronavirus. The Oscar–nominated singer-songwriter is receiving treatment at a hospital in upstate New York, his attorney Josh Grier told Variety, while dismissing initial reports that Schlesinger is in a coma.

“He’s very sick and is heavily sedated, as are all people on ventilators, but no one has used the word ‘coma’ to me,” Grier said. He added that the singer-songwriter has been in the hospital for over a week and has been receiving exceptional medical care, Variety noted.

Schlesinger is a prolific, award-winning performer, having been nominated for two Grammys with his band Fountains of Wayne, and later winning one for his work on the comedy album A Colbert Christmas: The Greatest Gift Of All! He’s also won three Emmys. Two were for outstanding music and lyrics for songs performed at the 65th and 66th Tony Awards; the other was for outstanding original music and lyrics for the song “Antidepressants Are So Not a Big Deal” on the musical series Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. Schlesinger wrote numerous songs for the series and served as its executive music producer.

He was nominated for a best-original-song Oscar in 1997 for penning the titular track for That Thing You Do!, the musical movie written and directed by Tom Hanks. Schlesinger is also an EGOT nominee, having been nominated for a best-original-score Tony and best musical in 2008 for his work on Cry-Baby.

To many, however, Schlesinger is perhaps best known as the co-frontman of Fountains of Wayne, the pop-rock band he cofounded in 1995. The band’s most famous song was “Stacy’s Mom,” a cheeky ode to the ’80s. Schlesinger also founded the bands Ivy and Tinted Window.
